title: Suggest move on closures

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

body:
```rust
fn main () {
    let _a = (0..255).flat_map(|x| (0..255).map(|y| (x, y))).collect::<Vec<_>>();
}
```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=32c45b5f6c2d71cc7beca9a1e355d06c&version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2015))

Errors:

```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0597]: `x` does not live long enough
 --> src/main.rs:3:54
  |
3 |     let _a = (0..255).flat_map(|x| (0..255).map(|y| (x, y))).collect::<Vec<_>>();
  |                                                 ---  ^    -                    - borrowed value needs to live until here
  |                                                 |    |    |
  |                                                 |    |    borrowed value only lives until here
  |                                                 |    borrowed value does not live long enough
  |                                                 capture occurs here

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0597`.
error: Could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```

The solution for this is 

        let a = (0..255).flat_map(|x| (0..255).map(move |y| (x, y))).collect::<Vec<_>>();

(`move` before the second closure).

I would like to see a hint for this, because in this case `x` is trivial copyable. I think, there are more possibilities for a `move` hint.
